message.content:
{"id": "104630", "title": "Bug 104630 - Column icons don't show up in connecting derby database", "description": "", "OB": "When connecting a derby database using a Data Source in the Data Explorer view, the column icons do not appear.", "EB": "", "SR": "Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new project.
2. Create a new report.
3. In the Data Explorer view, create a new Data Source to connect to a derby database with the following details:
   - Driver Class: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver
   - Database URL: jdbc:db2://spmdb:1527/gui
   - User Name: root
   - Password: root
4. After setting up the Data Source, create a dataset.
5. In the Edit Data Set window, select Query.
6. "}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

New a project2. New a report3. In Data Explorer view, New a Data Source to connect derby database:Driver Class: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2DriverDatabase URL: jdbc:db2://spmdb:1527/guiUser Name:rootPassword:root4. After set up Data Source, create a dataset5. In Edit Data SetData Set window, select Query.6. '}
